SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Groups.Transforms
Class OrientationTransform

java.lang.Object
  SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Node
      SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Group
          SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Groups.Transforms.TransformGroup
              SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Groups.Transforms.MatrixTransform
                  SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Groups.Transforms.OrientationTransform
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGL_Renderable
public class OrientationTransform
extends MatrixTransform

This class represents transformation nodes that both "rotate" an object to align it's x and y axes to specified "base" and "up" directions AND translates the "center" of the object to a specified position.

Constructor Detail

OrientationTransform

public OrientationTransform()
Construct an orientation transformation node that uses defaults of translation by (0,0,0) and no rotation.

OrientationTransform

public OrientationTransform(Vector3D base_vec,
                            Vector3D up_vec,
                            Vector3D position)
Construct an orientation transformation node using the specified position, base and up vectors.

Parameters:
base_vec - Vector that the local x-axis of the object should be mapped to.
up_vec - Vector that the local y-axis of the object should be mapped to.
position - The location that the center of the object should be mapped to.

setMatrix

public void setMatrix(Vector3D base_vec,
                      Vector3D up_vec,
                      Vector3D position)
Set this transform to be the transform representing a "rotation" to align the x,y axes with the specified base vector and up vector, AND translate to origin to the specified position.

Parameters:
base_vec - Vector that the local x-axis of the object should be mapped to.
up_vec - Vector that the local y-axis of the object should be mapped to.
position - The location that the center of the object should be mapped to.
